801
802/* Returns an opcode name from its number */
803
804static const char *
805lookup_opcode_name(ServerOpCodes code)
806{
807 u_int i;
808
809 for (i = 0; keywords[i].name != NULL; i++)
810 if (keywords[i].opcode == code)
811 return(keywords[i].name);
812 return "UNKNOWN";
813}
814
815
816/*
817 * Returns the number of the token pointed to by cp or sBadOption.
818 */
819
820static ServerOpCodes
821parse_token(const char *cp, const char *filename,
822 int linenum, u_int *flags)
823{
824 u_int i;
825
826 for (i = 0; keywords[i].name; i++)
827 if (strcasecmp(cp, keywords[i].name) == 0) {
828 debug ("Config token is %s", keywords[i].name);
829 *flags = keywords[i].flags;
830 return keywords[i].opcode;
831 }
832
833 error("%s: line %d: Bad configuration option: %s",
834 filename, linenum, cp);
835 return sBadOption;
836}
837
838char *
839derelativise_path(const char *path)
840{
841 char *expanded, *ret, cwd[PATH_MAX];
842
843 if (strcasecmp(path, "none") == 0)
844 return xstrdup("none");
845 expanded = tilde_expand_filename(path, getuid());
846 if (path_absolute(expanded))
847 return expanded;
848 if (getcwd(cwd, sizeof(cwd)) == NULL)
849 fatal("%s: getcwd: %s", __func__, strerror(errno));
850 xasprintf(&ret, "%s/%s", cwd, expanded);
851 free(expanded);
852 return ret;
853}
854
855static void
856add_listen_addr(ServerOptions *options, const char *addr,
857 const char *rdomain, int port)
858{
859 u_int i;
860
861 if (port > 0)
862 add_one_listen_addr(options, addr, rdomain, port);
863 else {
864 for (i = 0; i < options->num_ports; i++) {
865 add_one_listen_addr(options, addr, rdomain,
866 options->ports[i]);
867 }
868 }
869}
870
871static void
872add_one_listen_addr(ServerOptions *options, const char *addr,
873 const char *rdomain, int port)
874{
875 struct addrinfo hints, *ai, *aitop;
876 char strport[NI_MAXSERV];
877 int gaierr;
878 u_int i;
879
880 /* Find listen_addrs entry for this rdomain */
881 for (i = 0; i < options->num_listen_addrs; i++) {
882 if (rdomain == NULL && options->listen_addrs[i].rdomain == NULL)
883 break;
884 if (rdomain == NULL || options->listen_addrs[i].rdomain == NULL)
885 continue;
886 if (strcmp(rdomain, options->listen_addrs[i].rdomain) == 0)
887 break;
888 }
889 if (i >= options->num_listen_addrs) {
890 /* No entry for this rdomain; allocate one */
891 if (i >= INT_MAX)
892 fatal("%s: too many listen addresses", __func__);
893 options->listen_addrs = xrecallocarray(options->listen_addrs,
894 options->num_listen_addrs, options->num_listen_addrs + 1,
895 sizeof(*options->listen_addrs));
896 i = options->num_listen_addrs++;
897 if (rdomain != NULL)
898 options->listen_addrs[i].rdomain = xstrdup(rdomain);
899 }
900 /* options->listen_addrs[i] points to the addresses for this rdomain */
901
902 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
903 hints.ai_family = options->address_family;
904 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
905 hints.ai_flags = (addr == NULL) ? AI_PASSIVE : 0;
906 snprintf(strport, sizeof strport, "%d", port);
907 if ((gaierr = getaddrinfo(addr, strport, &hints, &aitop)) != 0)
908 fatal("bad addr or host: %s (%s)",
909 addr ? addr : "<NULL>",
910 ssh_gai_strerror(gaierr));
911 for (ai = aitop; ai->ai_next; ai = ai->ai_next)
912 ;
913 ai->ai_next = options->listen_addrs[i].addrs;
914 options->listen_addrs[i].addrs = aitop;
915}
916
917/* Returns nonzero if the routing domain name is valid */
918static int
919valid_rdomain(const char *name)
920{
921#ifdef NET_RT_TABLE
922 const char *errstr;
923 long long num;
924 struct rt_tableinfo info;
925 int mib[6];
926 size_t miblen = sizeof(mib);
927
928 if (name == NULL)
929 return 1;
930
931 num = strtonum(name, 0, 255, &errstr);
932 if (errstr != NULL)
933 return 0;
934
935 /* Check whether the table actually exists */
936 memset(mib, 0, sizeof(mib));
937 mib[0] = CTL_NET;
938 mib[1] = PF_ROUTE;
939 mib[4] = NET_RT_TABLE;
940 mib[5] = (int)num;
941 if (sysctl(mib, 6, &info, &miblen, NULL, 0) == -1)
942 return 0;
943
944 return 1;
945#else
946 return 0;
947#endif
948}
949
950/*
951 * Queue a ListenAddress to be processed once we have all of the Ports
952 * and AddressFamily options.
953 */
954static void
955queue_listen_addr(ServerOptions *options, const char *addr,
956 const char *rdomain, int port)
957{
958 struct queued_listenaddr *qla;
959
960 options->queued_listen_addrs = xrecallocarray(
961 options->queued_listen_addrs,
962 options->num_queued_listens, options->num_queued_listens + 1,
963 sizeof(*options->queued_listen_addrs));
964 qla = &options->queued_listen_addrs[options->num_queued_listens++];
965 qla->addr = xstrdup(addr);
966 qla->port = port;
967 qla->rdomain = rdomain == NULL ? NULL : xstrdup(rdomain);
968}
969
970/*
971 * Process queued (text) ListenAddress entries.
972 */
973static void
974process_queued_listen_addrs(ServerOptions *options)
975{
976 u_int i;
977 struct queued_listenaddr *qla;
978
979 if (options->num_ports == 0)
980 options->ports[options->num_ports++] = SSH_DEFAULT_PORT;
981 if (options->address_family == -1)
982 options->address_family = AF_UNSPEC;
983
984 for (i = 0; i < options->num_queued_listens; i++) {
985 qla = &options->queued_listen_addrs[i];
986 add_listen_addr(options, qla->addr, qla->rdomain, qla->port);
987 free(qla->addr);
988 free(qla->rdomain);
989 }
990 free(options->queued_listen_addrs);
991 options->queued_listen_addrs = NULL;
992 options->num_queued_listens = 0;
993}
994
995/*
996 * Inform channels layer of permitopen options for a single forwarding
997 * direction (local/remote).
998 */
999static void
1000process_permitopen_list(struct ssh *ssh, ServerOpCodes opcode,
1001 char **opens, u_int num_opens)
1002{
1003 u_int i;
1004 int port;
1005 char *host, *arg, *oarg, ch;
1006 int where = opcode == sPermitOpen ? FORWARD_LOCAL : FORWARD_REMOTE;
1007 const char *what = lookup_opcode_name(opcode);
1008
1009 channel_clear_permission(ssh, FORWARD_ADM, where);
1010 if (num_opens == 0)
1011 return; /* permit any */
1012
1013 /* handle keywords: "any" / "none" */
1014 if (num_opens == 1 && strcmp(opens[0], "any") == 0)
1015 return;
1016 if (num_opens == 1 && strcmp(opens[0], "none") == 0) {
1017 channel_disable_admin(ssh, where);
1018 return;
1019 }
1020 /* Otherwise treat it as a list of permitted host:port */
1021 for (i = 0; i < num_opens; i++) {
1022 oarg = arg = xstrdup(opens[i]);
1023 ch = '\0';
1024 host = hpdelim2(&arg, &ch);
1025 if (host == NULL || ch == '/')
1026 fatal("%s: missing host in %s", __func__, what);
1027 host = cleanhostname(host);
1028 if (arg == NULL || ((port = permitopen_port(arg)) < 0))
1029 fatal("%s: bad port number in %s", __func__, what);
1030 /* Send it to channels layer */
1031 channel_add_permission(ssh, FORWARD_ADM,
1032 where, host, port);
1033 free(oarg);
1034 }
1035}
1036
1037/*
1038 * Inform channels layer of permitopen options from configuration.
1039 */
1040void
1041process_permitopen(struct ssh *ssh, ServerOptions *options)
1042{
1043 process_permitopen_list(ssh, sPermitOpen,
1044 options->permitted_opens, options->num_permitted_opens);
1045 process_permitopen_list(ssh, sPermitListen,
1046 options->permitted_listens,
1047 options->num_permitted_listens);
1048}
1049
1050struct connection_info *
1051get_connection_info(struct ssh *ssh, int populate, int use_dns)
1052{
1053 static struct connection_info ci;
1054
1055 if (ssh == NULL || !populate)
1056 return &ci;
1057 ci.host = auth_get_canonical_hostname(ssh, use_dns);
1058 ci.address = ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh);
1059 ci.laddress = ssh_local_ipaddr(ssh);
1060 ci.lport = ssh_local_port(ssh);
1061 ci.rdomain = ssh_packet_rdomain_in(ssh);
1062 return &ci;
1063}
1064
1065/*
1066 * The strategy for the Match blocks is that the config file is parsed twice.
1067 *
1068 * The first time is at startup. activep is initialized to 1 and the
1069 * directives in the global context are processed and acted on. Hitting a
1070 * Match directive unsets activep and the directives inside the block are
1071 * checked for syntax only.
1072 *
1073 * The second time is after a connection has been established but before
1074 * authentication. activep is initialized to 2 and global config directives
1075 * are ignored since they have already been processed. If the criteria in a
1076 * Match block is met, activep is set and the subsequent directives
1077 * processed and actioned until EOF or another Match block unsets it. Any
1078 * options set are copied into the main server config.
1079 *
1080 * Potential additions/improvements:
1081 * - Add Match support for pre-kex directives, eg. Ciphers.
1082 *
1083 * - Add a Tag directive (idea from David Leonard) ala pf, eg:
1084 * Match Address 192.168.0.*
1085 * Tag trusted
1086 * Match Group wheel
1087 * Tag trusted
1088 * Match Tag trusted
1089 * AllowTcpForwarding yes
1090 * GatewayPorts clientspecified
1091 * [...]
1092 *
1093 * - Add a PermittedChannelRequests directive
1094 * Match Group shell
1095 * PermittedChannelRequests session,forwarded-tcpip
1096 */
1097
1098static int
1099match_cfg_line_group(const char *grps, int line, const char *user)
1100{
1101 int result = 0;
1102 struct passwd *pw;
1103
1104 if (user == NULL)
1105 goto out;
1106
1107 if ((pw = getpwnam(user)) == NULL) {
1108 debug("Can't match group at line %d because user %.100s does "
1109 "not exist", line, user);
1110 } else if (ga_init(pw->pw_name, pw->pw_gid) == 0) {
1111 debug("Can't Match group because user %.100s not in any group "
1112 "at line %d", user, line);
1113 } else if (ga_match_pattern_list(grps) != 1) {
1114 debug("user %.100s does not match group list %.100s at line %d",
1115 user, grps, line);
1116 } else {
1117 debug("user %.100s matched group list %.100s at line %d", user,
1118 grps, line);
1119 result = 1;
1120 }
1121out:
1122 ga_free();
1123 return result;
1124}
1125
1126__dead static void
1127match_test_missing_fatal(const char *criteria, const char *attrib)
1128{
1129 fatal("'Match %s' in configuration but '%s' not in connection "
1130 "test specification.", criteria, attrib);
1131}
1132
1133/*
1134 * All of the attributes on a single Match line are ANDed together, so we need
1135 * to check every attribute and set the result to zero if any attribute does
1136 * not match.
1137 */
1138static int
1139match_cfg_line(char **condition, int line, struct connection_info *ci)
1140{
1141 int result = 1, attributes = 0, port;
1142 char *arg, *attrib, *cp = *condition;
1143
1144 if (ci == NULL)
1145 debug3("checking syntax for 'Match %s'", cp);
1146 else
1147 debug3("checking match for '%s' user %s host %s addr %s "
1148 "laddr %s lport %d", cp, ci->user ? ci->user : "(null)",
1149 ci->host ? ci->host : "(null)",
1150 ci->address ? ci->address : "(null)",
1151 ci->laddress ? ci->laddress : "(null)", ci->lport);
1152
1153 while ((attrib = strdelim(&cp)) && *attrib != '\0') {
1154 attributes++;
1155 if (strcasecmp(attrib, "all") == 0) {
1156 if (attributes != 1 ||
1157 ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) != NULL && *arg != '\0')) {
1158 error("'all' cannot be combined with other "
1159 "Match attributes");
1160 return -1;
1161 }
1162 *condition = cp;
1163 return 1;
1164 }
1165 if ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) == NULL || *arg == '\0') {
1166 error("Missing Match criteria for %s", attrib);
1167 return -1;
1168 }
1169 if (strcasecmp(attrib, "user") == 0) {
1170 if (ci == NULL) {
1171 result = 0;
1172 continue;
1173 }
1174 if (ci->user == NULL)
1175 match_test_missing_fatal("User", "user");
1176 if (match_usergroup_pattern_list(ci->user, arg) != 1)
1177 result = 0;
1178 else
1179 debug("user %.100s matched 'User %.100s' at "
1180 "line %d", ci->user, arg, line);
1181 } else if (strcasecmp(attrib, "group") == 0) {
1182 if (ci == NULL) {
1183 result = 0;
1184 continue;
1185 }
1186 if (ci->user == NULL)
1187 match_test_missing_fatal("Group", "user");
1188 switch (match_cfg_line_group(arg, line, ci->user)) {
1189 case -1:
1190 return -1;
1191 case 0:
1192 result = 0;
1193 }
1194 } else if (strcasecmp(attrib, "host") == 0) {
1195 if (ci == NULL) {
1196 result = 0;
1197 continue;
1198 }
1199 if (ci->host == NULL)
1200 match_test_missing_fatal("Host", "host");
1201 if (match_hostname(ci->host, arg) != 1)
1202 result = 0;
1203 else
1204 debug("connection from %.100s matched 'Host "
1205 "%.100s' at line %d", ci->host, arg, line);
1206 } else if (strcasecmp(attrib, "address") == 0) {
1207 if (ci == NULL) {
1208 result = 0;
1209 continue;
1210 }
1211 if (ci->address == NULL)
1212 match_test_missing_fatal("Address", "addr");
1213 switch (addr_match_list(ci->address, arg)) {
1214 case 1:
1215 debug("connection from %.100s matched 'Address "
1216 "%.100s' at line %d", ci->address, arg, line);
1217 break;
1218 case 0:
1219 case -1:
1220 result = 0;
1221 break;
1222 case -2:
1223 return -1;
1224 }
1225 } else if (strcasecmp(attrib, "localaddress") == 0){
1226 if (ci == NULL) {
1227 result = 0;
1228 continue;
1229 }
1230 if (ci->laddress == NULL)
1231 match_test_missing_fatal("LocalAddress",
1232 "laddr");
1233 switch (addr_match_list(ci->laddress, arg)) {
1234 case 1:
1235 debug("connection from %.100s matched "
1236 "'LocalAddress %.100s' at line %d",
1237 ci->laddress, arg, line);
1238 break;
1239 case 0:
1240 case -1:
1241 result = 0;
1242 break;
1243 case -2:
1244 return -1;
1245 }
1246 } else if (strcasecmp(attrib, "localport") == 0) {
1247 if ((port = a2port(arg)) == -1) {
1248 error("Invalid LocalPort '%s' on Match line",
1249 arg);
1250 return -1;
1251 }
1252 if (ci == NULL) {
1253 result = 0;
1254 continue;
1255 }
1256 if (ci->lport == 0)
1257 match_test_missing_fatal("LocalPort", "lport");
1258 /* TODO support port lists */
1259 if (port == ci->lport)
1260 debug("connection from %.100s matched "
1261 "'LocalPort %d' at line %d",
1262 ci->laddress, port, line);
1263 else
1264 result = 0;
1265 } else if (strcasecmp(attrib, "rdomain") == 0) {
1266 if (ci == NULL || ci->rdomain == NULL) {
1267 result = 0;
1268 continue;
1269 }
1270 if (match_pattern_list(ci->rdomain, arg, 0) != 1)
1271 result = 0;
1272 else
1273 debug("user %.100s matched 'RDomain %.100s' at "
1274 "line %d", ci->rdomain, arg, line);
1275 } else {
1276 error("Unsupported Match attribute %s", attrib);
1277 return -1;
1278 }
1279 }
1280 if (attributes == 0) {
1281 error("One or more attributes required for Match");
1282 return -1;
1283 }
1284 if (ci != NULL)
1285 debug3("match %sfound", result ? "" : "not ");
1286 *condition = cp;
1287 return result;
1288}
1289
1290#define WHITESPACE " \t\r\n"
1291
1292/* Multistate option parsing */
1293struct multistate {
1294 const char *key;
1295 int value;
1296};
1297static const struct multistate multistate_flag[] = {
1298 { "yes", 1 },
1299 { "no", 0 },
1300 { NULL, -1 }
1301};
1302static const struct multistate multistate_addressfamily[] = {
1303 { "inet", AF_INET },
1304 { "inet6", AF_INET6 },
1305 { "any", AF_UNSPEC },
1306 { NULL, -1 }
1307};
1308static const struct multistate multistate_permitrootlogin[] = {
1309 { "without-password", PERMIT_NO_PASSWD },
1310 { "prohibit-password", PERMIT_NO_PASSWD },
1311 { "forced-commands-only", PERMIT_FORCED_ONLY },
1312 { "yes", PERMIT_YES },
1313 { "no", PERMIT_NO },
1314 { NULL, -1 }
1315};
1316static const struct multistate multistate_compression[] = {
1317 { "yes", COMP_DELAYED },
1318 { "delayed", COMP_DELAYED },
1319 { "no", COMP_NONE },
1320 { NULL, -1 }
1321};
1322static const struct multistate multistate_gatewayports[] = {
1323 { "clientspecified", 2 },
1324 { "yes", 1 },
1325 { "no", 0 },
1326 { NULL, -1 }
1327};
1328static const struct multistate multistate_tcpfwd[] = {
1329 { "yes", FORWARD_ALLOW },
1330 { "all", FORWARD_ALLOW },
1331 { "no", FORWARD_DENY },
1332 { "remote", FORWARD_REMOTE },
1333 { "local", FORWARD_LOCAL },
1334 { NULL, -1 }
1335};
1336
1337int
1338process_server_config_line(ServerOptions *options, char *line,
1339 const char *filename, int linenum, int *activep,
1340 struct connection_info *connectinfo)
1341{
1342 char ch, *cp, ***chararrayptr, **charptr, *arg, *arg2, *p;
1343 int cmdline = 0, *intptr, value, value2, n, port;
1344 SyslogFacility *log_facility_ptr;
1345 LogLevel *log_level_ptr;
1346#ifdef WITH_LDAP_PUBKEY
1347 unsigned long lvalue;
1348#endif
1349 time_t *timetptr __unused;
1350 ServerOpCodes opcode;
1351 u_int i, *uintptr, uvalue, flags = 0;
1352 size_t len;
1353 long long val64;
1354 const struct multistate *multistate_ptr;
1355 const char *errstr;
1356
1357 /* Strip trailing whitespace. Allow \f (form feed) at EOL only */
1358 if ((len = strlen(line)) == 0)
1359 return 0;
1360 for (len--; len > 0; len--) {
1361 if (strchr(WHITESPACE "\f", line[len]) == NULL)
1362 break;
1363 line[len] = '\0';
1364 }
1365
1366 cp = line;
1367 if ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) == NULL)
1368 return 0;
1369 /* Ignore leading whitespace */
1370 if (*arg == '\0')
1371 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1372 if (!arg || !*arg || *arg == '#')
1373 return 0;
1374 intptr = NULL;
1375 timetptr = NULL;
1376 charptr = NULL;
1377 opcode = parse_token(arg, filename, linenum, &flags);
1378
1379 if (activep == NULL) { /* We are processing a command line directive */
1380 cmdline = 1;
1381 activep = &cmdline;
1382 }
1383 if (*activep && opcode != sMatch)
1384 debug3("%s:%d setting %s %s", filename, linenum, arg, cp);
1385 if (*activep == 0 && !(flags & SSHCFG_MATCH)) {
1386 if (connectinfo == NULL) {
1387 fatal("%s line %d: Directive '%s' is not allowed "
1388 "within a Match block", filename, linenum, arg);
1389 } else { /* this is a directive we have already processed */
1390 while (arg)
1391 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1392 return 0;
1393 }
1394 }
1395
1396 switch (opcode) {
1397 /* Portable-specific options */
1398 case sUsePAM:
1399 intptr = &options->use_pam;
1400 goto parse_flag;
1401
1402 /* Standard Options */
1403 case sBadOption:
1404 return -1;
1405 case sPort:
1406 /* ignore ports from configfile if cmdline specifies ports */
1407 if (options->ports_from_cmdline)
1408 return 0;
1409 if (options->num_ports >= MAX_PORTS)
1410 fatal("%s line %d: too many ports.",
1411 filename, linenum);
1412 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1413 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1414 fatal("%s line %d: missing port number.",
1415 filename, linenum);
1416 options->ports[options->num_ports++] = a2port(arg);
1417 if (options->ports[options->num_ports-1] <= 0)
1418 fatal("%s line %d: Badly formatted port number.",
1419 filename, linenum);
1420 break;
1421
1422 case sLoginGraceTime:
1423 intptr = &options->login_grace_time;
1424 parse_time:
1425 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1426 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1427 fatal("%s line %d: missing time value.",
1428 filename, linenum);
1429 if ((value = convtime(arg)) == -1)
1430 fatal("%s line %d: invalid time value.",
1431 filename, linenum);
1432 if (*activep && *intptr == -1)
1433 *intptr = value;
1434 break;
1435
1436 case sListenAddress:
1437 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1438 if (arg == NULL || *arg == '\0')
1439 fatal("%s line %d: missing address",
1440 filename, linenum);
1441 /* check for bare IPv6 address: no "[]" and 2 or more ":" */
1442 if (strchr(arg, '[') == NULL && (p = strchr(arg, ':')) != NULL
1443 && strchr(p+1, ':') != NULL) {
1444 port = 0;
1445 p = arg;
1446 } else {
1447 arg2 = NULL;
1448 ch = '\0';
1449 p = hpdelim2(&arg, &ch);
1450 if (p == NULL || ch == '/')
1451 fatal("%s line %d: bad address:port usage",
1452 filename, linenum);
1453 p = cleanhostname(p);
1454 if (arg == NULL)
1455 port = 0;
1456 else if ((port = a2port(arg)) <= 0)
1457 fatal("%s line %d: bad port number",
1458 filename, linenum);
1459 }
1460 /* Optional routing table */
1461 arg2 = NULL;
1462 if ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) != NULL) {
1463 if (strcmp(arg, "rdomain") != 0 ||
1464 (arg2 = strdelim(&cp)) == NULL)
1465 fatal("%s line %d: bad ListenAddress syntax",
1466 filename, linenum);
1467 if (!valid_rdomain(arg2))
1468 fatal("%s line %d: bad routing domain",
1469 filename, linenum);
1470 }
1471
1472 queue_listen_addr(options, p, arg2, port);
1473
1474 break;
1475
1476 case sAddressFamily:
1477 intptr = &options->address_family;
1478 multistate_ptr = multistate_addressfamily;
1479 parse_multistate:
1480 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1481 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1482 fatal("%s line %d: missing argument.",
1483 filename, linenum);
1484 value = -1;
1485 for (i = 0; multistate_ptr[i].key != NULL; i++) {
1486 if (strcasecmp(arg, multistate_ptr[i].key) == 0) {
1487 value = multistate_ptr[i].value;
1488 break;
1489 }
1490 }
1491 if (value == -1)
1492 fatal("%s line %d: unsupported option \"%s\".",
1493 filename, linenum, arg);
1494 if (*activep && *intptr == -1)
1495 *intptr = value;
1496 break;
1497
1498 case sHostKeyFile:
1499 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1500 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1501 fatal("%s line %d: missing file name.",
1502 filename, linenum);
1503 if (*activep) {
1504 servconf_add_hostkey(filename, linenum,
1505 options, arg, 1);
1506 }
1507 break;
1508
1509 case sHostKeyAgent:
1510 charptr = &options->host_key_agent;
1511 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1512 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1513 fatal("%s line %d: missing socket name.",
1514 filename, linenum);
1515 if (*activep && *charptr == NULL)
1516 *charptr = !strcmp(arg, SSH_AUTHSOCKET_ENV_NAME) ?
1517 xstrdup(arg) : derelativise_path(arg);
1518 break;
1519
1520 case sHostCertificate:
1521 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1522 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1523 fatal("%s line %d: missing file name.",
1524 filename, linenum);
1525 if (*activep)
1526 servconf_add_hostcert(filename, linenum, options, arg);
1527 break;
1528
1529 case sPidFile:
1530 charptr = &options->pid_file;
1531 parse_filename:
1532 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1533 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1534 fatal("%s line %d: missing file name.",
1535 filename, linenum);
1536 if (*activep && *charptr == NULL) {
1537 *charptr = derelativise_path(arg);
1538 /* increase optional counter */
1539 if (intptr != NULL)
1540 *intptr = *intptr + 1;
1541 }
1542 break;
1543
1544 case sPermitRootLogin:
1545 intptr = &options->permit_root_login;
1546 multistate_ptr = multistate_permitrootlogin;
1547 goto parse_multistate;
1548
1549 case sIgnoreRhosts:
1550 intptr = &options->ignore_rhosts;
1551 parse_flag:
1552 multistate_ptr = multistate_flag;
1553 goto parse_multistate;
1554
1555 case sIgnoreRootRhosts:
1556 intptr = &options->ignore_root_rhosts;
1557 goto parse_flag;
1558
1559 case sNoneEnabled:
1560 intptr = &options->none_enabled;
1561 goto parse_flag;
1562
1563 case sTcpRcvBufPoll:
1564 intptr = &options->tcp_rcv_buf_poll;
1565 goto parse_flag;
1566
1567 case sHPNDisabled:
1568 intptr = &options->hpn_disabled;
1569 goto parse_flag;
1570
1571 case sHPNBufferSize:
1572 intptr = &options->hpn_buffer_size;
1573 goto parse_int;
1574
1575 case sIgnoreUserKnownHosts:
1576 intptr = &options->ignore_user_known_hosts;
1577 goto parse_flag;
1578
1579 case sHostbasedAuthentication:
1580 intptr = &options->hostbased_authentication;
1581 goto parse_flag;
1582
1583 case sHostbasedUsesNameFromPacketOnly:
1584 intptr = &options->hostbased_uses_name_from_packet_only;
1585 goto parse_flag;
1586
1587 case sHostbasedAcceptedKeyTypes:
1588 charptr = &options->hostbased_key_types;
1589 parse_keytypes:
1590 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1591 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1592 fatal("%s line %d: Missing argument.",
1593 filename, linenum);
1594 if (*arg != '-' &&
1595 !sshkey_names_valid2(*arg == '+' ? arg + 1 : arg, 1))
1596 fatal("%s line %d: Bad key types '%s'.",
1597 filename, linenum, arg ? arg : "<NONE>");
1598 if (*activep && *charptr == NULL)
1599 *charptr = xstrdup(arg);
1600 break;
1601
1602 case sHostKeyAlgorithms:
1603 charptr = &options->hostkeyalgorithms;
1604 goto parse_keytypes;
1605
1606 case sCASignatureAlgorithms:
1607 charptr = &options->ca_sign_algorithms;
1608 goto parse_keytypes;
1609
1610 case sPubkeyAuthentication:
1611 intptr = &options->pubkey_authentication;
1612 goto parse_flag;
1613
1614 case sPubkeyAcceptedKeyTypes:
1615 charptr = &options->pubkey_key_types;
1616 goto parse_keytypes;
1617
1618 case sKerberosAuthentication:
1619 intptr = &options->kerberos_authentication;
1620 goto parse_flag;
1621
1622 case sKerberosOrLocalPasswd:
1623 intptr = &options->kerberos_or_local_passwd;
1624 goto parse_flag;
1625
1626 case sKerberosTicketCleanup:
1627 intptr = &options->kerberos_ticket_cleanup;
1628 goto parse_flag;
1629
1630 case sKerberosTgtPassing:
1631 intptr = &options->kerberos_tgt_passing;
1632 goto parse_flag;
1633
1634 case sKerberosGetAFSToken:
1635 intptr = &options->kerberos_get_afs_token;
1636 goto parse_flag;
1637
1638 case sGssAuthentication:
1639 intptr = &options->gss_authentication;
1640 goto parse_flag;
1641
1642 case sGssCleanupCreds:
1643 intptr = &options->gss_cleanup_creds;
1644 goto parse_flag;
1645
1646 case sGssStrictAcceptor:
1647 intptr = &options->gss_strict_acceptor;
1648 goto parse_flag;
1649
1650 case sPasswordAuthentication:
1651 intptr = &options->password_authentication;
1652 goto parse_flag;
1653
1654 case sKbdInteractiveAuthentication:
1655 intptr = &options->kbd_interactive_authentication;
1656 goto parse_flag;
1657
1658 case sChallengeResponseAuthentication:
1659 intptr = &options->challenge_response_authentication;
1660 goto parse_flag;
1661
1662 case sPrintMotd:
1663 intptr = &options->print_motd;
1664 goto parse_flag;
1665
1666 case sPrintLastLog:
1667 intptr = &options->print_lastlog;
1668 goto parse_flag;
1669
1670 case sX11Forwarding:
1671 intptr = &options->x11_forwarding;
1672 goto parse_flag;
1673
1674 case sX11DisplayOffset:
1675 intptr = &options->x11_display_offset;
1676 parse_int:
1677 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1678 if ((errstr = atoi_err(arg, &value)) != NULL)
1679 fatal("%s line %d: integer value %s.",
1680 filename, linenum, errstr);
1681 if (*activep && *intptr == -1)
1682 *intptr = value;
1683 break;
1684
1685 case sX11UseLocalhost:
1686 intptr = &options->x11_use_localhost;
1687 goto parse_flag;
1688
1689 case sXAuthLocation:
1690 charptr = &options->xauth_location;
1691 goto parse_filename;
1692
1693 case sPermitTTY:
1694 intptr = &options->permit_tty;
1695 goto parse_flag;
1696
1697 case sPermitUserRC:
1698 intptr = &options->permit_user_rc;
1699 goto parse_flag;
1700
1701 case sStrictModes:
1702 intptr = &options->strict_modes;
1703 goto parse_flag;
1704
1705 case sTCPKeepAlive:
1706 intptr = &options->tcp_keep_alive;
1707 goto parse_flag;
1708
1709 case sEmptyPasswd:
1710 intptr = &options->permit_empty_passwd;
1711 goto parse_flag;
1712
1713 case sPermitUserEnvironment:
1714 intptr = &options->permit_user_env;
1715 charptr = &options->permit_user_env_whitelist;
1716 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1717 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1718 fatal("%s line %d: missing argument.",
1719 filename, linenum);
1720 value = 0;
1721 p = NULL;
1722 if (strcmp(arg, "yes") == 0)
1723 value = 1;
1724 else if (strcmp(arg, "no") == 0)
1725 value = 0;
1726 else {
1727 /* Pattern-list specified */
1728 value = 1;
1729 p = xstrdup(arg);
1730 }
1731 if (*activep && *intptr == -1) {
1732 *intptr = value;
1733 *charptr = p;
1734 p = NULL;
1735 }
1736 free(p);
1737 break;
1738
1739 case sCompression:
1740 intptr = &options->compression;
1741 multistate_ptr = multistate_compression;
1742 goto parse_multistate;
1743
1744 case sRekeyLimit:
1745 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1746 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1747 fatal("%.200s line %d: Missing argument.", filename,
1748 linenum);
1749 if (strcmp(arg, "default") == 0) {
1750 val64 = 0;
1751 } else {
1752 if (scan_scaled(arg, &val64) == -1)
1753 fatal("%.200s line %d: Bad number '%s': %s",
1754 filename, linenum, arg, strerror(errno));
1755 if (val64 != 0 && val64 < 16)
1756 fatal("%.200s line %d: RekeyLimit too small",
1757 filename, linenum);
1758 }
1759 if (*activep && options->rekey_limit == -1)
1760 options->rekey_limit = val64;
1761 if (cp != NULL) { /* optional rekey interval present */
1762 if (strcmp(cp, "none") == 0) {
1763 (void)strdelim(&cp); /* discard */
1764 break;
1765 }
1766 intptr = &options->rekey_interval;
1767 goto parse_time;
1768 }
1769 break;
1770
1771 case sGatewayPorts:
1772 intptr = &options->fwd_opts.gateway_ports;
1773 multistate_ptr = multistate_gatewayports;
1774 goto parse_multistate;
1775
1776 case sUseDNS:
1777 intptr = &options->use_dns;
1778 goto parse_flag;
1779
1780 case sLogFacility:
1781 log_facility_ptr = &options->log_facility;
1782 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1783 value = log_facility_number(arg);
1784 if (value == SYSLOG_FACILITY_NOT_SET)
1785 fatal("%.200s line %d: unsupported log facility '%s'",
1786 filename, linenum, arg ? arg : "<NONE>");
1787 if (*log_facility_ptr == -1)
1788 *log_facility_ptr = (SyslogFacility) value;
1789 break;
1790
1791 case sLogLevel:
1792 log_level_ptr = &options->log_level;
1793 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1794 value = log_level_number(arg);
1795 if (value == SYSLOG_LEVEL_NOT_SET)
1796 fatal("%.200s line %d: unsupported log level '%s'",
1797 filename, linenum, arg ? arg : "<NONE>");
1798 if (*activep && *log_level_ptr == -1)
1799 *log_level_ptr = (LogLevel) value;
1800 break;
1801
1802 case sAllowTcpForwarding:
1803 intptr = &options->allow_tcp_forwarding;
1804 multistate_ptr = multistate_tcpfwd;
1805 goto parse_multistate;
1806
1807 case sAllowStreamLocalForwarding:
1808 intptr = &options->allow_streamlocal_forwarding;
1809 multistate_ptr = multistate_tcpfwd;
1810 goto parse_multistate;
1811
1812 case sAllowAgentForwarding:
1813 intptr = &options->allow_agent_forwarding;
1814 goto parse_flag;
1815
1816 case sDisableForwarding:
1817 intptr = &options->disable_forwarding;
1818 goto parse_flag;
1819
1820 case sAllowUsers:
1821 while ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) && *arg != '\0') {
1822 if (match_user(NULL, NULL, NULL, arg) == -1)
1823 fatal("%s line %d: invalid AllowUsers pattern: "
1824 "\"%.100s\"", filename, linenum, arg);
1825 if (!*activep)
1826 continue;
1827 array_append(filename, linenum, "AllowUsers",
1828 &options->allow_users, &options->num_allow_users,
1829 arg);
1830 }
1831 break;
1832
1833 case sDenyUsers:
1834 while ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) && *arg != '\0') {
1835 if (match_user(NULL, NULL, NULL, arg) == -1)
1836 fatal("%s line %d: invalid DenyUsers pattern: "
1837 "\"%.100s\"", filename, linenum, arg);
1838 if (!*activep)
1839 continue;
1840 array_append(filename, linenum, "DenyUsers",
1841 &options->deny_users, &options->num_deny_users,
1842 arg);
1843 }
1844 break;
1845
1846 case sAllowGroups:
1847 while ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) && *arg != '\0') {
1848 if (!*activep)
1849 continue;
1850 array_append(filename, linenum, "AllowGroups",
1851 &options->allow_groups, &options->num_allow_groups,
1852 arg);
1853 }
1854 break;
1855
1856 case sDenyGroups:
1857 while ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) && *arg != '\0') {
1858 if (!*activep)
1859 continue;
1860 array_append(filename, linenum, "DenyGroups",
1861 &options->deny_groups, &options->num_deny_groups,
1862 arg);
1863 }
1864 break;
1865
1866 case sCiphers:
1867 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1868 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1869 fatal("%s line %d: Missing argument.", filename, linenum);
1870 if (*arg != '-' && !ciphers_valid(*arg == '+' ? arg + 1 : arg))
1871 fatal("%s line %d: Bad SSH2 cipher spec '%s'.",
1872 filename, linenum, arg ? arg : "<NONE>");
1873 if (options->ciphers == NULL)
1874 options->ciphers = xstrdup(arg);
1875 break;
1876
1877 case sMacs:
1878 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1879 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1880 fatal("%s line %d: Missing argument.", filename, linenum);
1881 if (*arg != '-' && !mac_valid(*arg == '+' ? arg + 1 : arg))
1882 fatal("%s line %d: Bad SSH2 mac spec '%s'.",
1883 filename, linenum, arg ? arg : "<NONE>");
1884 if (options->macs == NULL)
1885 options->macs = xstrdup(arg);
1886 break;
1887
1888 case sKexAlgorithms:
1889 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1890 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1891 fatal("%s line %d: Missing argument.",
1892 filename, linenum);
1893 if (*arg != '-' &&
1894 !kex_names_valid(*arg == '+' ? arg + 1 : arg))
1895 fatal("%s line %d: Bad SSH2 KexAlgorithms '%s'.",
1896 filename, linenum, arg ? arg : "<NONE>");
1897 if (options->kex_algorithms == NULL)
1898 options->kex_algorithms = xstrdup(arg);
1899 break;
1900
1901 case sSubsystem:
1902 if (options->num_subsystems >= MAX_SUBSYSTEMS) {
1903 fatal("%s line %d: too many subsystems defined.",
1904 filename, linenum);
1905 }
1906 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1907 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1908 fatal("%s line %d: Missing subsystem name.",
1909 filename, linenum);
1910 if (!*activep) {
1911 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1912 break;
1913 }
1914 for (i = 0; i < options->num_subsystems; i++)
1915 if (strcmp(arg, options->subsystem_name[i]) == 0)
1916 fatal("%s line %d: Subsystem '%s' already defined.",
1917 filename, linenum, arg);
1918 options->subsystem_name[options->num_subsystems] = xstrdup(arg);
1919 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1920 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1921 fatal("%s line %d: Missing subsystem command.",
1922 filename, linenum);
1923 options->subsystem_command[options->num_subsystems] = xstrdup(arg);
1924
1925 /* Collect arguments (separate to executable) */
1926 p = xstrdup(arg);
1927 len = strlen(p) + 1;
1928 while ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) != NULL && *arg != '\0') {
1929 len += 1 + strlen(arg);
1930 p = xreallocarray(p, 1, len);
1931 strlcat(p, " ", len);
1932 strlcat(p, arg, len);
1933 }
1934 options->subsystem_args[options->num_subsystems] = p;
1935 options->num_subsystems++;
1936 break;
1937
1938 case sMaxStartups:
1939 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1940 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1941 fatal("%s line %d: Missing MaxStartups spec.",
1942 filename, linenum);
1943 if ((n = sscanf(arg, "%d:%d:%d",
1944 &options->max_startups_begin,
1945 &options->max_startups_rate,
1946 &options->max_startups)) == 3) {
1947 if (options->max_startups_begin >
1948 options->max_startups ||
1949 options->max_startups_rate > 100 ||
1950 options->max_startups_rate < 1)
1951 fatal("%s line %d: Illegal MaxStartups spec.",
1952 filename, linenum);
1953 } else if (n != 1)
1954 fatal("%s line %d: Illegal MaxStartups spec.",
1955 filename, linenum);
1956 else
1957 options->max_startups = options->max_startups_begin;
1958 break;
1959
1960 case sMaxAuthTries:
1961 intptr = &options->max_authtries;
1962 goto parse_int;
1963
1964 case sMaxSessions:
1965 intptr = &options->max_sessions;
1966 goto parse_int;
1967
1968 case sBanner:
1969 charptr = &options->banner;
1970 goto parse_filename;
1971
1972 /*
1973 * These options can contain %X options expanded at
1974 * connect time, so that you can specify paths like:
1975 *
1976 * AuthorizedKeysFile /etc/ssh_keys/%u
1977 */
1978 case sAuthorizedKeysFile:
1979 if (*activep && options->num_authkeys_files == 0) {
1980 while ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) && *arg != '\0') {
1981 arg = tilde_expand_filename(arg, getuid());
1982 array_append(filename, linenum,
1983 "AuthorizedKeysFile",
1984 &options->authorized_keys_files,
1985 &options->num_authkeys_files, arg);
1986 free(arg);
1987 }
1988 }
1989 return 0;
1990
1991 case sAuthorizedPrincipalsFile:
1992 charptr = &options->authorized_principals_file;
1993 arg = strdelim(&cp);
1994 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
1995 fatal("%s line %d: missing file name.",
1996 filename, linenum);
1997 if (*activep && *charptr == NULL) {
1998 *charptr = tilde_expand_filename(arg, getuid());
1999 /* increase optional counter */
2000 if (intptr != NULL)
2001 *intptr = *intptr + 1;
2002 }
2003 break;
2004
2005 case sClientAliveInterval:
2006 intptr = &options->client_alive_interval;
2007 goto parse_time;
2008
2009 case sClientAliveCountMax:
2010 intptr = &options->client_alive_count_max;
2011 goto parse_int;
2012
2013 case sAcceptEnv:
2014 while ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) && *arg != '\0') {
2015 if (strchr(arg, '=') != NULL)
2016 fatal("%s line %d: Invalid environment name.",
2017 filename, linenum);
2018 if (!*activep)
2019 continue;
2020 array_append(filename, linenum, "AcceptEnv",
2021 &options->accept_env, &options->num_accept_env,
2022 arg);
2023 }
2024 break;
2025
2026 case sSetEnv:
2027 uvalue = options->num_setenv;
2028 while ((arg = strdelimw(&cp)) && *arg != '\0') {
2029 if (strchr(arg, '=') == NULL)
2030 fatal("%s line %d: Invalid environment.",
2031 filename, linenum);
2032 if (!*activep || uvalue != 0)
2033 continue;
2034 array_append(filename, linenum, "SetEnv",
2035 &options->setenv, &options->num_setenv, arg);
2036 }
2037 break;
2038
2039 case sPermitTunnel:
2040 intptr = &options->permit_tun;
2041 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2042 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2043 fatal("%s line %d: Missing yes/point-to-point/"
2044 "ethernet/no argument.", filename, linenum);
2045 value = -1;
2046 for (i = 0; tunmode_desc[i].val != -1; i++)
2047 if (strcmp(tunmode_desc[i].text, arg) == 0) {
2048 value = tunmode_desc[i].val;
2049 break;
2050 }
2051 if (value == -1)
2052 fatal("%s line %d: Bad yes/point-to-point/ethernet/"
2053 "no argument: %s", filename, linenum, arg);
2054 if (*activep && *intptr == -1)
2055 *intptr = value;
2056 break;
2057
2058 case sMatch:
2059 if (cmdline)
2060 fatal("Match directive not supported as a command-line "
2061 "option");
2062 value = match_cfg_line(&cp, linenum, connectinfo);
2063 if (value < 0)
2064 fatal("%s line %d: Bad Match condition", filename,
2065 linenum);
2066 *activep = value;
2067 break;
2068
2069 case sPermitListen:
2070 case sPermitOpen:
2071 if (opcode == sPermitListen) {
2072 uintptr = &options->num_permitted_listens;
2073 chararrayptr = &options->permitted_listens;
2074 } else {
2075 uintptr = &options->num_permitted_opens;
2076 chararrayptr = &options->permitted_opens;
2077 }
2078 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2079 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2080 fatal("%s line %d: missing %s specification",
2081 filename, linenum, lookup_opcode_name(opcode));
2082 uvalue = *uintptr; /* modified later */
2083 if (strcmp(arg, "any") == 0 || strcmp(arg, "none") == 0) {
2084 if (*activep && uvalue == 0) {
2085 *uintptr = 1;
2086 *chararrayptr = xcalloc(1,
2087 sizeof(**chararrayptr));
2088 (*chararrayptr)[0] = xstrdup(arg);
2089 }
2090 break;
2091 }
2092 for (; arg != NULL && *arg != '\0'; arg = strdelim(&cp)) {
2093 if (opcode == sPermitListen &&
2094 strchr(arg, ':') == NULL) {
2095 /*
2096 * Allow bare port number for PermitListen
2097 * to indicate a wildcard listen host.
2098 */
2099 xasprintf(&arg2, "*:%s", arg);
2100 } else {
2101 arg2 = xstrdup(arg);
2102 ch = '\0';
2103 p = hpdelim2(&arg, &ch);
2104 if (p == NULL || ch == '/') {
2105 fatal("%s line %d: missing host in %s",
2106 filename, linenum,
2107 lookup_opcode_name(opcode));
2108 }
2109 p = cleanhostname(p);
2110 }
2111 if (arg == NULL ||
2112 ((port = permitopen_port(arg)) < 0)) {
2113 fatal("%s line %d: bad port number in %s",
2114 filename, linenum,
2115 lookup_opcode_name(opcode));
2116 }
2117 if (*activep && uvalue == 0) {
2118 array_append(filename, linenum,
2119 lookup_opcode_name(opcode),
2120 chararrayptr, uintptr, arg2);
2121 }
2122 free(arg2);
2123 }
2124 break;
2125
2126 case sForceCommand:
2127 if (cp == NULL || *cp == '\0')
2128 fatal("%.200s line %d: Missing argument.", filename,
2129 linenum);
2130 len = strspn(cp, WHITESPACE);
2131 if (*activep && options->adm_forced_command == NULL)
2132 options->adm_forced_command = xstrdup(cp + len);
2133 return 0;
2134
2135 case sChrootDirectory:
2136 charptr = &options->chroot_directory;
2137
2138 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2139 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2140 fatal("%s line %d: missing file name.",
2141 filename, linenum);
2142 if (*activep && *charptr == NULL)
2143 *charptr = xstrdup(arg);
2144 break;
2145
2146 case sTrustedUserCAKeys:
2147 charptr = &options->trusted_user_ca_keys;
2148 goto parse_filename;
2149
2150 case sRevokedKeys:
2151 charptr = &options->revoked_keys_file;
2152 goto parse_filename;
2153
2154 case sIPQoS:
2155 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2156 if ((value = parse_ipqos(arg)) == -1)
2157 fatal("%s line %d: Bad IPQoS value: %s",
2158 filename, linenum, arg);
2159 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2160 if (arg == NULL)
2161 value2 = value;
2162 else if ((value2 = parse_ipqos(arg)) == -1)
2163 fatal("%s line %d: Bad IPQoS value: %s",
2164 filename, linenum, arg);
2165 if (*activep) {
2166 options->ip_qos_interactive = value;
2167 options->ip_qos_bulk = value2;
2168 }
2169 break;
2170
2171 case sVersionAddendum:
2172 if (cp == NULL || *cp == '\0')
2173 fatal("%.200s line %d: Missing argument.", filename,
2174 linenum);
2175 len = strspn(cp, WHITESPACE);
2176 if (*activep && options->version_addendum == NULL) {
2177 if (strcasecmp(cp + len, "none") == 0)
2178 options->version_addendum = xstrdup("");
2179 else if (strchr(cp + len, '\r') != NULL)
2180 fatal("%.200s line %d: Invalid argument",
2181 filename, linenum);
2182 else
2183 options->version_addendum = xstrdup(cp + len);
2184 }
2185 return 0;
2186
2187 case sAuthorizedKeysCommand:
2188 if (cp == NULL)
2189 fatal("%.200s line %d: Missing argument.", filename,
2190 linenum);
2191 len = strspn(cp, WHITESPACE);
2192 if (*activep && options->authorized_keys_command == NULL) {
2193 if (cp[len] != '/' && strcasecmp(cp + len, "none") != 0)
2194 fatal("%.200s line %d: AuthorizedKeysCommand "
2195 "must be an absolute path",
2196 filename, linenum);
2197 options->authorized_keys_command = xstrdup(cp + len);
2198 }
2199 return 0;
2200
2201 case sAuthorizedKeysCommandUser:
2202 charptr = &options->authorized_keys_command_user;
2203
2204 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2205 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2206 fatal("%s line %d: missing AuthorizedKeysCommandUser "
2207 "argument.", filename, linenum);
2208 if (*activep && *charptr == NULL)
2209 *charptr = xstrdup(arg);
2210 break;
2211
2212 case sAuthorizedPrincipalsCommand:
2213 if (cp == NULL)
2214 fatal("%.200s line %d: Missing argument.", filename,
2215 linenum);
2216 len = strspn(cp, WHITESPACE);
2217 if (*activep &&
2218 options->authorized_principals_command == NULL) {
2219 if (cp[len] != '/' && strcasecmp(cp + len, "none") != 0)
2220 fatal("%.200s line %d: "
2221 "AuthorizedPrincipalsCommand must be "
2222 "an absolute path", filename, linenum);
2223 options->authorized_principals_command =
2224 xstrdup(cp + len);
2225 }
2226 return 0;
2227
2228 case sAuthorizedPrincipalsCommandUser:
2229 charptr = &options->authorized_principals_command_user;
2230
2231 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2232 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2233 fatal("%s line %d: missing "
2234 "AuthorizedPrincipalsCommandUser argument.",
2235 filename, linenum);
2236 if (*activep && *charptr == NULL)
2237 *charptr = xstrdup(arg);
2238 break;
2239
2240 case sAuthenticationMethods:
2241 if (options->num_auth_methods == 0) {
2242 value = 0; /* seen "any" pseudo-method */
2243 value2 = 0; /* successfully parsed any method */
2244 while ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) && *arg != '\0') {
2245 if (strcmp(arg, "any") == 0) {
2246 if (options->num_auth_methods > 0) {
2247 fatal("%s line %d: \"any\" "
2248 "must appear alone in "
2249 "AuthenticationMethods",
2250 filename, linenum);
2251 }
2252 value = 1;
2253 } else if (value) {
2254 fatal("%s line %d: \"any\" must appear "
2255 "alone in AuthenticationMethods",
2256 filename, linenum);
2257 } else if (auth2_methods_valid(arg, 0) != 0) {
2258 fatal("%s line %d: invalid "
2259 "authentication method list.",
2260 filename, linenum);
2261 }
2262 value2 = 1;
2263 if (!*activep)
2264 continue;
2265 array_append(filename, linenum,
2266 "AuthenticationMethods",
2267 &options->auth_methods,
2268 &options->num_auth_methods, arg);
2269 }
2270 if (value2 == 0) {
2271 fatal("%s line %d: no AuthenticationMethods "
2272 "specified", filename, linenum);
2273 }
2274 }
2275 return 0;
2276
2277 case sStreamLocalBindMask:
2278 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2279 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2280 fatal("%s line %d: missing StreamLocalBindMask "
2281 "argument.", filename, linenum);
2282 /* Parse mode in octal format */
2283 value = strtol(arg, &p, 8);
2284 if (arg == p || value < 0 || value > 0777)
2285 fatal("%s line %d: Bad mask.", filename, linenum);
2286 if (*activep)
2287 options->fwd_opts.streamlocal_bind_mask = (mode_t)value;
2288 break;
2289
2290 case sStreamLocalBindUnlink:
2291 intptr = &options->fwd_opts.streamlocal_bind_unlink;
2292 goto parse_flag;
2293
2294 case sFingerprintHash:
2295 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2296 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2297 fatal("%.200s line %d: Missing argument.",
2298 filename, linenum);
2299 if ((value = ssh_digest_alg_by_name(arg)) == -1)
2300 fatal("%.200s line %d: Invalid hash algorithm \"%s\".",
2301 filename, linenum, arg);
2302 if (*activep)
2303 options->fingerprint_hash = value;
2304 break;
2305
2306 case sExposeAuthInfo:
2307 intptr = &options->expose_userauth_info;
2308 goto parse_flag;
2309
2310 case sRDomain:
2311 charptr = &options->routing_domain;
2312 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2313 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2314 fatal("%.200s line %d: Missing argument.",
2315 filename, linenum);
2316 if (strcasecmp(arg, "none") != 0 && strcmp(arg, "%D") != 0 &&
2317 !valid_rdomain(arg))
2318 fatal("%s line %d: bad routing domain",
2319 filename, linenum);
2320 if (*activep && *charptr == NULL)
2321 *charptr = xstrdup(arg);
2322 break;
2323
2324 case sDeprecated:
2325 case sIgnore:
2326 case sUnsupported:
2327 do_log2(opcode == sIgnore ?
2328 SYSLOG_LEVEL_DEBUG2 : SYSLOG_LEVEL_INFO,
2329 "%s line %d: %s option %s", filename, linenum,
2330 opcode == sUnsupported ? "Unsupported" : "Deprecated", arg);
2331 while (arg)
2332 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2333 break;
2334
2335#ifdef WITH_LDAP_PUBKEY
2336 case sLdapPublickey:
2337 intptr = &options->lpk.on;
2338 goto parse_flag;
2339 case sLdapServers:
2340 /* arg = strdelim(&cp); */
2341 p = line;
2342 while(*p++);
2343 arg = p;
2344 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2345 fatal("%s line %d: missing ldap server",filename,linenum);
2346 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2347 if ((options->lpk.servers = ldap_parse_servers(arg)) == NULL)
2348 fatal("%s line %d: error in ldap servers", filename, linenum);
2349 memset(arg,0,strlen(arg));
2350 break;
2351 case sLdapUserDN:
2352 arg = cp;
2353 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2354 fatal("%s line %d: missing ldap server",filename,linenum);
2355 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2356 options->lpk.u_basedn = xstrdup(arg);
2357 memset(arg,0,strlen(arg));
2358 break;
2359 case sLdapGroupDN:
2360 arg = cp;
2361 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2362 fatal("%s line %d: missing ldap server",filename,linenum);
2363 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2364 options->lpk.g_basedn = xstrdup(arg);
2365 memset(arg,0,strlen(arg));
2366 break;
2367 case sBindDN:
2368 arg = cp;
2369 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2370 fatal("%s line %d: missing binddn",filename,linenum);
2371 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2372 options->lpk.binddn = xstrdup(arg);
2373 memset(arg,0,strlen(arg));
2374 break;
2375 case sBindPw:
2376 arg = cp;
2377 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2378 fatal("%s line %d: missing bindpw",filename,linenum);
2379 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2380 options->lpk.bindpw = xstrdup(arg);
2381 memset(arg,0,strlen(arg));
2382 break;
2383 case sMyGroup:
2384 arg = cp;
2385 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2386 fatal("%s line %d: missing groupname",filename, linenum);
2387 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2388 options->lpk.sgroup = xstrdup(arg);
2389 if (options->lpk.sgroup)
2390 options->lpk.fgroup = ldap_parse_groups(options->lpk.sgroup);
2391 memset(arg,0,strlen(arg));
2392 break;
2393 case sLdapFilter:
2394 arg = cp;
2395 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2396 fatal("%s line %d: missing filter",filename, linenum);
2397 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2398 options->lpk.filter = xstrdup(arg);
2399 memset(arg,0,strlen(arg));
2400 break;
2401 case sForceTLS:
2402 intptr = &options->lpk.tls;
2403 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2404 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2405 fatal("%s line %d: missing yes/no argument.",
2406 filename, linenum);
2407 value = 0; /* silence compiler */
2408 if (strcmp(arg, "yes") == 0)
2409 value = 1;
2410 else if (strcmp(arg, "no") == 0)
2411 value = 0;
2412 else if (strcmp(arg, "try") == 0)
2413 value = -1;
2414 else
2415 fatal("%s line %d: Bad yes/no argument: %s",
2416 filename, linenum, arg);
2417 if (*intptr == -1)
2418 *intptr = value;
2419 break;
2420 case sBindTimeout:
2421 timetptr = &options->lpk.b_timeout.tv_sec;
2422parse_ulong:
2423 arg = strdelim(&cp);
2424 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2425 fatal("%s line %d: missing integer value.",
2426 filename, linenum);
2427 lvalue = atol(arg);
2428 if (*activep && *timetptr == -1)
2429 *timetptr = lvalue;
2430 break;
2431
2432 case sSearchTimeout:
2433 timetptr = &options->lpk.s_timeout.tv_sec;
2434 goto parse_ulong;
2435 break;
2436 case sLdapConf:
2437 arg = cp;
2438 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2439 fatal("%s line %d: missing LpkLdapConf", filename, linenum);
2440 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2441 options->lpk.l_conf = xstrdup(arg);
2442 memset(arg, 0, strlen(arg));
2443 break;
2444 case sLpkPubKeyAttr:
2445 arg = cp;
2446 if (!arg || *arg == '\0')
2447 fatal("%s line %d: missing pubkeyattr",filename,linenum);
2448 arg[strlen(arg)] = '\0';
2449 options->lpk.pub_key_attr = xstrdup(arg);
2450 memset(arg,0,strlen(arg));
2451 break;
2452
2453#endif
2454
2455 default:
2456 fatal("%s line %d: Missing handler for opcode %s (%d)",
2457 filename, linenum, arg, opcode);
2458 }
2459 if ((arg = strdelim(&cp)) != NULL && *arg != '\0')
2460 fatal("%s line %d: garbage at end of line; \"%.200s\".",
2461 filename, linenum, arg);
2462 return 0;
2463}
2464
2465/* Reads the server configuration file. */
2466
2467void
2468load_server_config(const char *filename, struct sshbuf *conf)
2469{
2470 char *line = NULL, *cp;
2471 size_t linesize = 0;
2472 FILE *f;
2473 int r, lineno = 0;
2474
2475 debug2("%s: filename %s", __func__, filename);
2476 if ((f = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL) {
2477 perror(filename);
2478 exit(1);
2479 }
2480 sshbuf_reset(conf);
2481 while (getline(&line, &linesize, f) != -1) {
2482 lineno++;
2483 /*
2484 * Trim out comments and strip whitespace
2485 * NB - preserve newlines, they are needed to reproduce
2486 * line numbers later for error messages
2487 */
2488 if ((cp = strchr(line, '#')) != NULL)
2489 memcpy(cp, "\n", 2);
2490 cp = line + strspn(line, " \t\r");
2491 if ((r = sshbuf_put(conf, cp, strlen(cp))) != 0)
2492 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
2493 }
2494 free(line);
2495 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(conf, 0)) != 0)
2496 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
2497 fclose(f);
2498 debug2("%s: done config len = %zu", __func__, sshbuf_len(conf));
2499}
2500
2501void
2502parse_server_match_config(ServerOptions *options,
2503 struct connection_info *connectinfo)
2504{
2505 ServerOptions mo;
2506
2507 initialize_server_options(&mo);
2508 parse_server_config(&mo, "reprocess config", cfg, connectinfo);
2509 copy_set_server_options(options, &mo, 0);
2510}
2511
2512int parse_server_match_testspec(struct connection_info *ci, char *spec)
2513{
2514 char *p;
2515
2516 while ((p = strsep(&spec, ",")) && *p != '\0') {
2517 if (strncmp(p, "addr=", 5) == 0) {
2518 ci->address = xstrdup(p + 5);
2519 } else if (strncmp(p, "host=", 5) == 0) {
2520 ci->host = xstrdup(p + 5);
2521 } else if (strncmp(p, "user=", 5) == 0) {
2522 ci->user = xstrdup(p + 5);
2523 } else if (strncmp(p, "laddr=", 6) == 0) {
2524 ci->laddress = xstrdup(p + 6);
2525 } else if (strncmp(p, "rdomain=", 8) == 0) {
2526 ci->rdomain = xstrdup(p + 8);
2527 } else if (strncmp(p, "lport=", 6) == 0) {
2528 ci->lport = a2port(p + 6);
2529 if (ci->lport == -1) {
2530 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid port '%s' in test mode"
2531 " specification %s\n", p+6, p);
2532 return -1;
2533 }
2534 } else {
2535 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid test mode specification %s\n",
2536 p);
2537 return -1;
2538 }
2539 }
2540 return 0;
2541}
2542
2543/*
2544 * Copy any supported values that are set.
2545 *
2546 * If the preauth flag is set, we do not bother copying the string or
2547 * array values that are not used pre-authentication, because any that we
2548 * do use must be explicitly sent in mm_getpwnamallow().
2549 */
2550void
2551copy_set_server_options(ServerOptions *dst, ServerOptions *src, int preauth)
2552{
2553#define M_CP_INTOPT(n) do {\
2554 if (src->n != -1) \
2555 dst->n = src->n; \
2556} while (0)
2557
2558 M_CP_INTOPT(password_authentication);
2559 M_CP_INTOPT(gss_authentication);
2560 M_CP_INTOPT(pubkey_authentication);
2561 M_CP_INTOPT(kerberos_authentication);
2562 M_CP_INTOPT(hostbased_authentication);
2563 M_CP_INTOPT(hostbased_uses_name_from_packet_only);
2564 M_CP_INTOPT(kbd_interactive_authentication);
2565 M_CP_INTOPT(permit_root_login);
2566 M_CP_INTOPT(permit_empty_passwd);
2567
2568 M_CP_INTOPT(allow_tcp_forwarding);
2569 M_CP_INTOPT(allow_streamlocal_forwarding);
2570 M_CP_INTOPT(allow_agent_forwarding);
2571 M_CP_INTOPT(disable_forwarding);
2572 M_CP_INTOPT(expose_userauth_info);
2573 M_CP_INTOPT(permit_tun);
2574 M_CP_INTOPT(fwd_opts.gateway_ports);
2575 M_CP_INTOPT(fwd_opts.streamlocal_bind_unlink);
2576 M_CP_INTOPT(x11_display_offset);
2577 M_CP_INTOPT(x11_forwarding);
2578 M_CP_INTOPT(x11_use_localhost);
2579 M_CP_INTOPT(permit_tty);
2580 M_CP_INTOPT(permit_user_rc);
2581 M_CP_INTOPT(max_sessions);
2582 M_CP_INTOPT(max_authtries);
2583 M_CP_INTOPT(client_alive_count_max);
2584 M_CP_INTOPT(client_alive_interval);
2585 M_CP_INTOPT(ip_qos_interactive);
2586 M_CP_INTOPT(ip_qos_bulk);
2587 M_CP_INTOPT(rekey_limit);
2588 M_CP_INTOPT(rekey_interval);
2589 M_CP_INTOPT(log_level);
2590
2591 /*
2592 * The bind_mask is a mode_t that may be unsigned, so we can't use
2593 * M_CP_INTOPT - it does a signed comparison that causes compiler
2594 * warnings.
2595 */
2596 if (src->fwd_opts.streamlocal_bind_mask != (mode_t)-1) {
2597 dst->fwd_opts.streamlocal_bind_mask =
2598 src->fwd_opts.streamlocal_bind_mask;
2599 }
2600
2601 /* M_CP_STROPT and M_CP_STRARRAYOPT should not appear before here */
2602#define M_CP_STROPT(n) do {\
2603 if (src->n != NULL && dst->n != src->n) { \
2604 free(dst->n); \
2605 dst->n = src->n; \
2606 } \
2607} while(0)
2608#define M_CP_STRARRAYOPT(s, num_s) do {\
2609 u_int i; \
2610 if (src->num_s != 0) { \
2611 for (i = 0; i < dst->num_s; i++) \
2612 free(dst->s[i]); \
2613 free(dst->s); \
2614 dst->s = xcalloc(src->num_s, sizeof(*dst->s)); \
2615 for (i = 0; i < src->num_s; i++) \
2616 dst->s[i] = xstrdup(src->s[i]); \
2617 dst->num_s = src->num_s; \
2618 } \
2619} while(0)
2620
2621 /* See comment in servconf.h */
2622 COPY_MATCH_STRING_OPTS();
2623
2624 /* Arguments that accept '+...' need to be expanded */
2625 assemble_algorithms(dst);
2626
2627 /*
2628 * The only things that should be below this point are string options
2629 * which are only used after authentication.
2630 */
2631 if (preauth)
2632 return;
2633
2634 /* These options may be "none" to clear a global setting */
2635 M_CP_STROPT(adm_forced_command);
2636 if (option_clear_or_none(dst->adm_forced_command)) {
2637 free(dst->adm_forced_command);
2638 dst->adm_forced_command = NULL;
2639 }
2640 M_CP_STROPT(chroot_directory);
2641 if (option_clear_or_none(dst->chroot_directory)) {
2642 free(dst->chroot_directory);
2643 dst->chroot_directory = NULL;
2644 }
2645}
2646
2647#undef M_CP_INTOPT
2648#undef M_CP_STROPT
2649#undef M_CP_STRARRAYOPT
2650
2651void
2652parse_server_config(ServerOptions *options, const char *filename,
2653 struct sshbuf *conf, struct connection_info *connectinfo)
2654{
2655 int active, linenum, bad_options = 0;
2656 char *cp, *obuf, *cbuf;
2657
2658 debug2("%s: config %s len %zu", __func__, filename, sshbuf_len(conf));
2659
2660 if ((obuf = cbuf = sshbuf_dup_string(conf)) == NULL)
2661 fatal("%s: sshbuf_dup_string failed", __func__);
2662 active = connectinfo ? 0 : 1;
2663 linenum = 1;
2664 while ((cp = strsep(&cbuf, "\n")) != NULL) {
2665 if (process_server_config_line(options, cp, filename,
2666 linenum++, &active, connectinfo) != 0)
2667 bad_options++;
2668 }
2669 free(obuf);
2670 if (bad_options > 0)
2671 fatal("%s: terminating, %d bad configuration options",
2672 filename, bad_options);
2673 process_queued_listen_addrs(options);
2674}
2675
2676static const char *
2677fmt_multistate_int(int val, const struct multistate *m)
2678{
2679 u_int i;
2680
2681 for (i = 0; m[i].key != NULL; i++) {
2682 if (m[i].value == val)
2683 return m[i].key;
2684 }
2685 return "UNKNOWN";
2686}
2687
2688static const char *
2689fmt_intarg(ServerOpCodes code, int val)
2690{
2691 if (val == -1)
2692 return "unset";
2693 switch (code) {
2694 case sAddressFamily:
2695 return fmt_multistate_int(val, multistate_addressfamily);
2696 case sPermitRootLogin:
2697 return fmt_multistate_int(val, multistate_permitrootlogin);
2698 case sGatewayPorts:
2699 return fmt_multistate_int(val, multistate_gatewayports);
2700 case sCompression:
2701 return fmt_multistate_int(val, multistate_compression);
2702 case sAllowTcpForwarding:
2703 return fmt_multistate_int(val, multistate_tcpfwd);
2704 case sAllowStreamLocalForwarding:
2705 return fmt_multistate_int(val, multistate_tcpfwd);
2706 case sFingerprintHash:
2707 return ssh_digest_alg_name(val);
2708 default:
2709 switch (val) {
2710 case 0:
2711 return "no";
2712 case 1:
2713 return "yes";
2714 default:
2715 return "UNKNOWN";
2716 }
2717 }
2718}
2719
2720static void
2721dump_cfg_int(ServerOpCodes code, int val)
2722{
2723 printf("%s %d\n", lookup_opcode_name(code), val);
2724}
2725
2726static void
2727dump_cfg_oct(ServerOpCodes code, int val)
2728{
2729 printf("%s 0%o\n", lookup_opcode_name(code), val);
2730}
2731
2732static void
2733dump_cfg_fmtint(ServerOpCodes code, int val)
2734{
2735 printf("%s %s\n", lookup_opcode_name(code), fmt_intarg(code, val));
2736}
2737
2738static void
2739dump_cfg_string(ServerOpCodes code, const char *val)
2740{
2741 printf("%s %s\n", lookup_opcode_name(code),
2742 val == NULL ? "none" : val);
2743}
2744
2745static void
2746dump_cfg_strarray(ServerOpCodes code, u_int count, char **vals)
2747{
2748 u_int i;
2749
2750 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
2751 printf("%s %s\n", lookup_opcode_name(code), vals[i]);
2752}
2753
2754static void
2755dump_cfg_strarray_oneline(ServerOpCodes code, u_int count, char **vals)
2756{
2757 u_int i;
2758
2759 if (count <= 0 && code != sAuthenticationMethods)
2760 return;
2761 printf("%s", lookup_opcode_name(code));
2762 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
2763 printf(" %s", vals[i]);
2764 if (code == sAuthenticationMethods && count == 0)
2765 printf(" any");
2766 printf("\n");
2767}
2768
2769static char *
2770format_listen_addrs(struct listenaddr *la)
2771{
2772 int r;
2773 struct addrinfo *ai;
2774 char addr[NI_MAXHOST], port[NI_MAXSERV];
2775 char *laddr1 = xstrdup(""), *laddr2 = NULL;
2776
2777 /*
2778 * ListenAddress must be after Port. add_one_listen_addr pushes
2779 * addresses onto a stack, so to maintain ordering we need to
2780 * print these in reverse order.
2781 */
2782 for (ai = la->addrs; ai; ai = ai->ai_next) {
2783 if ((r = getnameinfo(ai->ai_addr, ai->ai_addrlen, addr,
2784 sizeof(addr), port, sizeof(port),
2785 NI_NUMERICHOST|NI_NUMERICSERV)) != 0) {
2786 error("getnameinfo: %.100s", ssh_gai_strerror(r));
2787 continue;
2788 }
2789 laddr2 = laddr1;
2790 if (ai->ai_family == AF_INET6) {
2791 xasprintf(&laddr1, "listenaddress [%s]:%s%s%s\n%s",
2792 addr, port,
2793 la->rdomain == NULL ? "" : " rdomain ",
2794 la->rdomain == NULL ? "" : la->rdomain,
2795 laddr2);
2796 } else {
2797 xasprintf(&laddr1, "listenaddress %s:%s%s%s\n%s",
2798 addr, port,
2799 la->rdomain == NULL ? "" : " rdomain ",
2800 la->rdomain == NULL ? "" : la->rdomain,
2801 laddr2);
2802 }
2803 free(laddr2);
2804 }
2805 return laddr1;
2806}
2807
2808void
2809dump_config(ServerOptions *o)
2810{
2811 const char *s;
2812 u_int i;
2813
2814 /* these are usually at the top of the config */
2815 for (i = 0; i < o->num_ports; i++)
2816 printf("port %d\n", o->ports[i]);
2817 dump_cfg_fmtint(sAddressFamily, o->address_family);
2818
2819 for (i = 0; i < o->num_listen_addrs; i++) {
2820 char *ss = format_listen_addrs(&o->listen_addrs[i]);
2821 printf("%s", ss);
2822 free(ss);
2823 }
2824
2825 /* integer arguments */
2826 dump_cfg_int(sLoginGraceTime, o->login_grace_time);
2827 dump_cfg_int(sX11DisplayOffset, o->x11_display_offset);
2828 dump_cfg_int(sMaxAuthTries, o->max_authtries);
2829 dump_cfg_int(sMaxSessions, o->max_sessions);
2830 dump_cfg_int(sClientAliveInterval, o->client_alive_interval);
2831 dump_cfg_int(sClientAliveCountMax, o->client_alive_count_max);
2832 dump_cfg_oct(sStreamLocalBindMask, o->fwd_opts.streamlocal_bind_mask);
2833
2834 /* formatted integer arguments */
2835 dump_cfg_fmtint(sPermitRootLogin, o->permit_root_login);
2836 dump_cfg_fmtint(sIgnoreRhosts, o->ignore_rhosts);
2837 dump_cfg_fmtint(sIgnoreUserKnownHosts, o->ignore_user_known_hosts);
2838 dump_cfg_fmtint(sHostbasedAuthentication, o->hostbased_authentication);
2839 dump_cfg_fmtint(sHostbasedUsesNameFromPacketOnly,
2840 o->hostbased_uses_name_from_packet_only);
2841 dump_cfg_fmtint(sPubkeyAuthentication, o->pubkey_authentication);
2842#ifdef KRB5
2843 dump_cfg_fmtint(sKerberosAuthentication, o->kerberos_authentication);
2844 dump_cfg_fmtint(sKerberosOrLocalPasswd, o->kerberos_or_local_passwd);
2845 dump_cfg_fmtint(sKerberosTicketCleanup, o->kerberos_ticket_cleanup);
2846 dump_cfg_fmtint(sKerberosGetAFSToken, o->kerberos_get_afs_token);
2847#endif
2848#ifdef GSSAPI
2849 dump_cfg_fmtint(sGssAuthentication, o->gss_authentication);
2850 dump_cfg_fmtint(sGssCleanupCreds, o->gss_cleanup_creds);
2851#endif
2852 dump_cfg_fmtint(sPasswordAuthentication, o->password_authentication);
2853 dump_cfg_fmtint(sKbdInteractiveAuthentication,
2854 o->kbd_interactive_authentication);
2855 dump_cfg_fmtint(sChallengeResponseAuthentication,
2856 o->challenge_response_authentication);
2857 dump_cfg_fmtint(sPrintMotd, o->print_motd);
2858 dump_cfg_fmtint(sPrintLastLog, o->print_lastlog);
2859 dump_cfg_fmtint(sX11Forwarding, o->x11_forwarding);
2860 dump_cfg_fmtint(sX11UseLocalhost, o->x11_use_localhost);
2861 dump_cfg_fmtint(sPermitTTY, o->permit_tty);
2862 dump_cfg_fmtint(sPermitUserRC, o->permit_user_rc);
2863 dump_cfg_fmtint(sStrictModes, o->strict_modes);
2864 dump_cfg_fmtint(sTCPKeepAlive, o->tcp_keep_alive);
2865 dump_cfg_fmtint(sEmptyPasswd, o->permit_empty_passwd);
2866 dump_cfg_fmtint(sCompression, o->compression);
2867 dump_cfg_fmtint(sGatewayPorts, o->fwd_opts.gateway_ports);
2868 dump_cfg_fmtint(sUseDNS, o->use_dns);
2869 dump_cfg_fmtint(sAllowTcpForwarding, o->allow_tcp_forwarding);
2870 dump_cfg_fmtint(sAllowAgentForwarding, o->allow_agent_forwarding);
2871 dump_cfg_fmtint(sDisableForwarding, o->disable_forwarding);
2872 dump_cfg_fmtint(sAllowStreamLocalForwarding, o->allow_streamlocal_forwarding);
2873 dump_cfg_fmtint(sStreamLocalBindUnlink, o->fwd_opts.streamlocal_bind_unlink);
2874 dump_cfg_fmtint(sFingerprintHash, o->fingerprint_hash);
2875 dump_cfg_fmtint(sExposeAuthInfo, o->expose_userauth_info);
2876
2877 /* string arguments */
2878 dump_cfg_string(sPidFile, o->pid_file);
2879 dump_cfg_string(sXAuthLocation, o->xauth_location);
2880 dump_cfg_string(sCiphers, o->ciphers ? o->ciphers : KEX_SERVER_ENCRYPT);
2881 dump_cfg_string(sMacs, o->macs ? o->macs : KEX_SERVER_MAC);
2882 dump_cfg_string(sBanner, o->banner);
2883 dump_cfg_string(sForceCommand, o->adm_forced_command);
2884 dump_cfg_string(sChrootDirectory, o->chroot_directory);
2885 dump_cfg_string(sTrustedUserCAKeys, o->trusted_user_ca_keys);
2886 dump_cfg_string(sRevokedKeys, o->revoked_keys_file);
2887 dump_cfg_string(sAuthorizedPrincipalsFile,
2888 o->authorized_principals_file);
2889 dump_cfg_string(sVersionAddendum, *o->version_addendum == '\0'
2890 ? "none" : o->version_addendum);
2891 dump_cfg_string(sAuthorizedKeysCommand, o->authorized_keys_command);
2892 dump_cfg_string(sAuthorizedKeysCommandUser, o->authorized_keys_command_user);
2893 dump_cfg_string(sAuthorizedPrincipalsCommand, o->authorized_principals_command);
2894 dump_cfg_string(sAuthorizedPrincipalsCommandUser, o->authorized_principals_command_user);
2895 dump_cfg_string(sHostKeyAgent, o->host_key_agent);
2896 dump_cfg_string(sKexAlgorithms,
2897 o->kex_algorithms ? o->kex_algorithms : KEX_SERVER_KEX);
2898 dump_cfg_string(sCASignatureAlgorithms, o->ca_sign_algorithms ?
2899 o->ca_sign_algorithms : SSH_ALLOWED_CA_SIGALGS);
2900 dump_cfg_string(sHostbasedAcceptedKeyTypes, o->hostbased_key_types ?
2901 o->hostbased_key_types : KEX_DEFAULT_PK_ALG);
2902 dump_cfg_string(sHostKeyAlgorithms, o->hostkeyalgorithms ?
2903 o->hostkeyalgorithms : KEX_DEFAULT_PK_ALG);
2904 dump_cfg_string(sPubkeyAcceptedKeyTypes, o->pubkey_key_types ?
2905 o->pubkey_key_types : KEX_DEFAULT_PK_ALG);
2906 dump_cfg_string(sRDomain, o->routing_domain);
2907
2908 /* string arguments requiring a lookup */
2909 dump_cfg_string(sLogLevel, log_level_name(o->log_level));
2910 dump_cfg_string(sLogFacility, log_facility_name(o->log_facility));
2911
2912 /* string array arguments */
2913 dump_cfg_strarray_oneline(sAuthorizedKeysFile, o->num_authkeys_files,
2914 o->authorized_keys_files);
2915 dump_cfg_strarray(sHostKeyFile, o->num_host_key_files,
2916 o->host_key_files);
2917 dump_cfg_strarray(sHostCertificate, o->num_host_cert_files,
2918 o->host_cert_files);
2919 dump_cfg_strarray(sAllowUsers, o->num_allow_users, o->allow_users);
2920 dump_cfg_strarray(sDenyUsers, o->num_deny_users, o->deny_users);
2921 dump_cfg_strarray(sAllowGroups, o->num_allow_groups, o->allow_groups);
2922 dump_cfg_strarray(sDenyGroups, o->num_deny_groups, o->deny_groups);
2923 dump_cfg_strarray(sAcceptEnv, o->num_accept_env, o->accept_env);
2924 dump_cfg_strarray(sSetEnv, o->num_setenv, o->setenv);
2925 dump_cfg_strarray_oneline(sAuthenticationMethods,
2926 o->num_auth_methods, o->auth_methods);
2927
2928 /* other arguments */
2929 for (i = 0; i < o->num_subsystems; i++)
2930 printf("subsystem %s %s\n", o->subsystem_name[i],
2931 o->subsystem_args[i]);
2932
2933 printf("maxstartups %d:%d:%d\n", o->max_startups_begin,
2934 o->max_startups_rate, o->max_startups);
2935
2936 s = NULL;
2937 for (i = 0; tunmode_desc[i].val != -1; i++) {
2938 if (tunmode_desc[i].val == o->permit_tun) {
2939 s = tunmode_desc[i].text;
2940 break;
2941 }
2942 }
2943 dump_cfg_string(sPermitTunnel, s);
2944
2945 printf("ipqos %s ", iptos2str(o->ip_qos_interactive));
2946 printf("%s\n", iptos2str(o->ip_qos_bulk));
2947
2948 printf("rekeylimit %llu %d\n", (unsigned long long)o->rekey_limit,
2949 o->rekey_interval);
2950
2951 printf("permitopen");
2952 if (o->num_permitted_opens == 0)
2953 printf(" any");
2954 else {
2955 for (i = 0; i < o->num_permitted_opens; i++)
2956 printf(" %s", o->permitted_opens[i]);
2957 }
2958 printf("\n");
2959 printf("permitlisten");
2960 if (o->num_permitted_listens == 0)
2961 printf(" any");
2962 else {
2963 for (i = 0; i < o->num_permitted_listens; i++)
2964 printf(" %s", o->permitted_listens[i]);
2965 }
2966 printf("\n");
2967
2968 if (o->permit_user_env_whitelist == NULL) {
2969 dump_cfg_fmtint(sPermitUserEnvironment, o->permit_user_env);
2970 } else {
2971 printf("permituserenvironment %s\n",
2972 o->permit_user_env_whitelist);
2973 }
2974
2975}
